title: A beginner’s guide to AI: Machine superiority
content:
There currently exists no machine capable of superhuman feats of intelligence. I’m sorry to be the one who bursts your bubble but, at least for the time being, that’s the way the universe works. It might seem like AI is smarter than humans in some ways. For example, the powerful neural networks used by big tech can sort through millions of files in a matter of seconds, a feat that would take humans more than a single lifetime. But that’s not a superhuman feat of intellect. It’s trading human attention for machine speed. On a file per file basis, there…

This story continues at The Next Web
description: One machine to rule them all, the god device, the robot overlords, whatever you call it. How worried should we be about "superhuman" AI?
